comments: If X is an n-set and Y and Z disjoint 2-subsets of X then a(n-4) is equal to the number of 6-subsets of X intersecting both Y and Z. - _Milan Janjic_, Aug 26 2007For n>0, a(n+1) is the n-th antidiagonal sum of A213751. - _Clark Kimberling_, Jun 20 2012This sequence is the case m=n-1, k=n+3 of b(m,k) = m*(m+1)*((k-2)*m-(k-5))/6, which is the m-th k-gonal pyramidal number. - _Luciano Ancora_, Apr 11 2015Starting (1, 7, 26, ...), this is the binomial transform of (1, 6, 13, 12, 4, 0, 0, 0, ...). - _Gary W. Adamson_, Jul 31 2015
